result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • John R Henz was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • John R Henz was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $1,300 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by probation agent.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.
Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations. Defendant attended the 2/11/16 Door/Kewaunee Victim Impact Panel.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by probation agent.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant apologizes to the court, makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant John R Henz in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant John R Henz in custody.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 1 to OWI 5th, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as charged. Court dismisses Ct. 3, 15-TR-1360 and 15-TR-1361 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect. Sentencing 2/15/16 at 3:30 PM.

Defendant John R Henz in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant John R Henz in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer indicates defendant no longer wishes to take either matter to trial, requests a plea and sentencing date. State has no objection to continuance. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant John R Henz in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant John R Henz in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant John R Henz in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant John R Henz in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer accepts court appointment. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Defendant John R Henz in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant is now requesting a court appointed attorney as he doesn't qualify for PD representation. Court appoints Atty Linda Schaefer to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $100 per month toward atty fees. First payment is due by 9/30/15. Atty Schaefer is due back in court later this afternoon. Court will recall case at 3:45 pm.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant John R Henz in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel at this point, would like time to meet with ADA Korb to discuss both cases. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant John R Henz in court, in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Court reviews options regarding counsel. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds Defendant competent, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Discussion regarding blood results. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 6/29/15.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant John R Henz appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 7/13/15, 10:00.
